content.rendered:
What is a Respiratory Therapist?

Respiratory Therapists examine and advise treatment for patients that have trouble breathing.

Where does a Respiratory Therapist work?

  • Rehabilitation centers
  • Diagnostic labs
  • Other medical clinics

How much does a Respiratory Therapist make?

Based on real new grad salaries reported through Handshake, the median annual salary for a Respiratory Therapist is $54,986.

What majors are typically interested in becoming Respiratory Therapists?

One’s major doesn’t necessarily determine their career, but these are some common majors of those who end up pursuing this career path.

  • Physiology majors
  • Anatomy majors
  • Health science majors
Search Respiratory Therapist job opportunities on Handshake.

Respiratory Therapist skills and competencies:

On top of a relevant degree and formal training, here are some professional skills that can help aspiring Respiratory Therapists succeed in their work:

  • Respiratory Therapist credentials (CRT and RRT)
  • Great perception and listening skills

What are some common questions about Respiratory Therapists?

Q: How long does it take to become a licensed respiratory therapist?

A: A minimum of 2 years.
